question: Some delivery drivers for this company went on strike from December 20-24, 2024 at the peak of Christmas package season. The drivers were part of the Teamsters union which only represents a small fraction of the company's more than 70,000 employees. This company's logo features an arrow pointing from A to Z, symbolizing its vast selection and its goal to deliver everything to everyone. Its founder initially envisioned the company as an online bookstore named Cadabra. Its headquarters, located in Seattle, Washington, features unique biodome spheres that house thousands of plants from around the world. It has expanded beyond e-commerce to become a major player in cloud computing, artificial intelligence, and entertainment. What is the name of this multinational technology company founded by Jeff Bezos?

This North American chain of stores announced in December 2024 it will close all of its 800+ locations. This company, known for its vast assortment of party supplies and costumes, filed for bankruptcy in January 2023, facing challenges from online retailers and shifting consumer trends. Its iconic retail stores, often adorned with colorful balloons and festive decorations, have been a staple for party planners and last-minute shoppers. Name this company that is the largest retailer of party goods in Canada, Puerto Rico, and Mexico.

US workers at this coffee chain ended a five-day strike on Christmas Day 2024. The company's origins trace back to 1971, when it was founded in Seattle's Pike Place Market, selling coffee beans and brewing equipment. It has since expanded to over 33,000 stores in 80 countries, becoming a global coffeehouse giant. This company, whose logo features a siren from Greek mythology, introduced the Frappuccino, a blended iced coffee drink, in 1995, and it quickly became a signature offering and cultural phenomenon. Name this worldwide coffee chain.

An Azerbaijan Airlines flight recently crashed in this country, killing 38 people on December 25, 2024. Azerbaijan has since claimed the plane was shot down by Russian air defense systems. This country, the largest landlocked country in the world, is home to the Baikonur Cosmodrome, the world's first and largest operational space launch facility. Its capital city, Astana, boasts futuristic architecture, including the Baiterek Tower, a 97-meter-tall observation tower with a golden orb symbolizing a mythical bird's egg. It is also the world's largest producer of uranium and a significant exporter of oil and gas. What is this Central Asian nation, known for its vast steppes, nomadic traditions, and the hit film "Borat"?

Israel launched an attack against the Houthi rebels in this nation. This country, located on the southern tip of the Arabian Peninsula, is home to the ancient city of Sana'a, a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its distinctive tower houses.  It is the poorest country in the Arab world, facing a devastating humanitarian crisis due to an ongoing civil war.  It is also where the "Dragon's Blood Tree" grows, a unique species with red sap that has been used for centuries for medicinal and dye purposes.  What is this country, known for its rich history and its ongoing conflict?

A Jeju Air Flight returning from Thailand recently crashed at Muan International Airport in this nation, killing 189 people. This country, known for its high-speed internet and tech-savvy population, is home to the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ), a heavily fortified border that separates it from its northern neighbor. Its capital city, Seoul, boasts a vibrant mix of modern skyscrapers and historic palaces, including the UNESCO-listed Changdeokgung Palace. It is also a global leader in the production of electronics and automobiles, with brands like Samsung and Hyundai recognized worldwide. What is this East Asian nation, known for its K-pop music, delicious kimchi, and innovative technology?

This US president died on December 29, 2024. He was a prolific writer, setting a record for most New York Times best-selling books by a president. However, fewer books were written about him than any other modern president. He was the oldest US president in history, dying at age 100. This man negociated the Camp David Accords between Egypt and Israel. Name this politician from Plains, Georgia who lost his reelection campaign to Ronald Reagan.
